intro: Artemisia × taraspensis, commonly known as the Tarasp mountain wormwood, is a hybrid shrub native to the alpine regions of Europe. It is characterized by its aromatic, silver-gray foliage and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in summer. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. It is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and its ability to tolerate harsh conditions. The essential oils produced by the plant have been studied for their potential medicinal properties.
